snippet: An icebreaker carrying a key piece of equipment for Arctic drilling planned by Royal Dutch Shell off the northern coast of Alaska was forced to return to dock after a hole more than three feet long was discovered in its hull.
abstract: Royal Dutch Shell says icebreaker carting equipment for Arctic drilling was forced to return to dock due to hull damage.
lead_paragraph: An icebreaker carrying a key piece of equipment for Arctic drilling planned by Royal Dutch Shell off the northern coast of Alaska was forced to return to dock after a hole more than three feet long was discovered in its hull.

headline.main: Alaska: Equipment Needed for Arctic Drilling Is Delayed
headline.print_headline: Alaska: Equipment Needed for Arctic Drilling Is Delayed
